Description: Tondo sherd of Attic red-figured pottery cup, probably type B; interior: part of border of stopt maeander between reserved bands; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of part of Herakles (paw and tail of lion's skin remaining) and of a female figure (part of chiton and himation remaining), both to left; relief-contour.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 512, no. C81)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 237, no. 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0654) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain Fasc. 3, Oxford Fasc. 1 (p. 13, pl. XIV, no. 17)
Hogarth, Lorimer & Edgar 1905 / Naukratis 1903 (p. 122, pl. VII, no. 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
